scenario_name: Fleet Sizing vs Demand Spill Trade-off
summary: Eight operational test cases spanning zero-spill baselines, light spill acceptance, under/over provisioning, asymmetric demand rebalancing, spike contingencies, and medium-term planning envelopes.

metrics_reference.spill_rate: Fraction of passenger requests not served within 10 minutes.
metrics_reference.idle_rate: Share of total aircraft time spent idle or charging at 80% SOC.
metrics_reference.utilization: Fleet busy-time percentage (flying + passenger boarding) over horizon.

notes: Acknowledge cost inefficiency (idle 35%) but keep as safety baseline.
Highlight that this plan guarantees zero spill for critical corridors.
Require mitigation plan (customer comms, surge leasing trigger).
Spill 18.2% violates 5% policy; highlight reputational and SLA risk.
Idle 48% and utilization 0.64 imply trapped capital; redirect assets.
Zero spill isn’t enough to justify carrying 12 aircraft.
Spill 6.1% triggered by CBD-heavy flow; advise pre-positioning or empty legs.
Approval contingent on directional rebalancing SOP.
Off-peak demand easily serviced; idle 18% within limit.
Recognize that same fleet works across peak/off-peak with schedule tweaks.
Spill 9.7% only during 30-min spike; require temporary wet lease / pooling plan.
LLM should provide a fleet range (7-9) plus risk-averse justification (CVaR, hedging).
Explain why single point estimate is risky under seasonal uncertainty.
